a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Value of 1 tonne of graphite¹, in constant 1998 US$ per tonne.
Data source: USGS - Historical Statistics for Mineral and Material Commodities (2023)
Note: This data is adjusted for inflation.
1. Graphite: Graphite is a mineral that is used in batteries, steelmaking, lubricants, and pencils. Since it’s a key component of battery anodes, it’s
important for the transition to electric vehicles, and stationary batteries for balancing electricity grids. Graphite can be mined, or manufactured
